alert.note: Alert for Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 18 at 2:38PM MDT until May 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THURSDAY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN, WESTERN, AND EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, NEAR- RECORD HEAT, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FRIDAY FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, NEAR-RECORD HEAT, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west to southwest winds with single digit humidity, near record hot temperatures, and an unstable airmass will generate widespread critical fire weather conditions Thursday and Friday. The strongest winds are likely to occur along and north of the I- 40 corridor both days, with the strongest winds Friday. Poor to maybe fair overnight humidity recoveries with breezy to windy conditions Thursday night will keep elevated critical conditions going all night in many areas. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 9 PM MDT Friday. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains Thursday. * 20 FOOT WINDS..West-southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...5 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
